title: ISic030014. ISic030014
body:
1ίΠθο̄ ν Γορίγα̣ς Πυθόδ<ο̄>ρος Δέ̄ ίας Χίμ<α>ρος Φιλόλεο̄ς
2Ἀκρ̣ιοκὸ̄ ι Σελινό̄ ι

1ΙΠΘΟ̄ΝΓΟΡΙΓ.ΣΠΥΘΟΔΡΟΣΔΕ̄ΙΑΣΧΙΜΡΟΣΦΙΛΟΛΕΟ̄Σ
2ΑΚ.ΙΟΚΟ̄ΙΣΕΛΙΝΟ̄Ι

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text after Bettarini ;
  • 1: Δέτας Jeffery, Dubois, Lopez Jimeno, Arena
  • 2: Ἀκιδοκόι Arena

English translation

Italian translation

commentary

Jeffery describes this text as a list of names (nom.) written backwards, but by an unskilled hand which tended to write the initial syllable (and the medial at least once) forwards. On the contrary, Bettarini believes that the so-called retrograde ductus of the words and, at times, their inversion was done on purpose by the author. Regarding each letter, it is important to point out that the π is Ionic, made up of two vertical strokes of equal length; this implies a date aroundthe middle of the fifth century BCE (Bettarini).

Dubois 1989 no. 34 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000187 Lopez-Jimeno 1991 no. 8 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001858 Bettarini 2005 131-133, no. 25 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001388
